acknowledgeEdge(bytes32,bytes).details: This function is used to acknowledge an edge that was previously created and will revert if the edge does not exist. It emits an {EdgeAcknowledged} event for the edge.

params.data_: Additional data to include with the acknowledgment.
params.edgeId_: The ID of the edge to acknowledge.

acknowledgeEdge(bytes32,bytes,bytes).details: The request is valid if the given signature was produced using the edge ID as the message and the creator of the `to` node as the signer.This function is used to acknowledge an edge that was previously created and will revert if the edge does not exist or if the signature is invalid. It emits an {EdgeAcknowledged} event for the edge.

params.data_: Additional data to include with the acknowledgment.
params.edgeId_: The ID of the edge to acknowledge.

cancelOwnershipHandover().details: Cancels the two-step ownership handover to the caller, if any.

completeOwnershipHandover(address).details: Allows the owner to complete the two-step ownership handover to `pendingOwner`. Reverts if there is no existing ownership handover requested by `pendingOwner`.

createEdge((uint8,(uint256,address),(uin.details: This function is used to create a new edge between two nodes in the graph and will revert if not unique or if called by any address other than the contract referenced as the `from` node. A {NodeTouched} event is emitted for each node and an {EdgeCreated} event is emitted for the edge itself.

params.from_: The {Node} from which the edge originates.
params.to_: The {Node} to which the edge points.

createEdges(((uint8,(uint256,address),(u.details: This function is used to create multiple edges within the graph and will revert if any of the edges are not unique. It emits a {NodeTouched} event for each node and an {EdgeCreated} event for each edge.

params.edge_: The edge for which to get the ID.

returns._0: edgeId The ID of the edge (i.e. the keccak256 hash of the `from` and `to` nodes).

params.from_: The source node of the edge.
params.to_: The target node of the edge.

returns._0: edgeId The ID of the edge (i.e. the keccak256 hash of the `from` and `to` nodes).

grantRoles(address,uint256).details: This function is used to grant roles to an address and will revert if the caller is not the owner and does not have the `ADMIN_ROLE`.

params.guy: The address to grant the roles.

owner().details: Returns the owner of the contract.

ownershipHandoverExpiresAt(address).details: Returns the expiry timestamp for the two-step ownership handover to `pendingOwner`.

proxiableUUID().details: Returns the storage slot used by the implementation, as specified in [ERC1822](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1822). Note: The `notDelegated` modifier prevents accidental upgrades to an implementation that is a proxy contract.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the owner to renounce their ownership.

renounceRoles(uint256).details: Allow the caller to remove their own roles. If the caller does not have a role, then it will be an no-op for the role.

requestOwnershipHandover().details: Request a two-step ownership handover to the caller. The request will automatically expire in 48 hours (172800 seconds) by default.

revokeRoles(address,uint256).details: This function is used to revoke roles from an address and will revert if the caller is not the owner and does not have the `ADMIN_ROLE`.

params.guy: The address from which to revoke the roles.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the owner to transfer the ownership to `newOwner`.

unacknowledgeEdge(bytes32,bytes).details: This function is used to unacknowledge an edge that was previously acknowledged.

params.data_: Additional data to include with the unacknowledgment.
params.edgeId_: The ID of the edge to unacknowledge.

unacknowledgeEdge(bytes32,bytes,bytes).details: The request is valid if the given signature was produced using the edge ID as the message and the creator of the `to` node as the signer.This function is used to unacknowledge an edge that was previously acknowledged and will revert if the edge does not exist or if the signature is invalid. It emits an {EdgeUnacknowledged} event for the edge.

params.data_: Additional data to include with the unacknowledgment.
params.edgeId_: The ID of the edge to unacknowledge.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrades the proxy's implementation to `newImplementation`. Emits a {Upgraded} event. Note: Passing in empty `data` skips the delegatecall to `newImplementation`.

acknowledgeEdge(bytes32,bytes,bytes).notice: Acknowledge an edge using an ECDSA signature.

createEdge((uint8,(uint256,address),(uin.notice: Create a new {Edge} between two {Node}s in the graph.

createEdges(((uint8,(uint256,address),(u.notice: Create multiple edges within the graph.

edges(bytes32).notice: Edges are relationships between two nodes in the graph.

getEdgeId(((uint8,(uint256,address),(uin.notice: Get the ID of an edge.

getEdgeId((uint8,(uint256,address),(uint.notice: Get the ID of an edge given the source and target nodes.

grantRoles(address,uint256).notice: Override the {OwnableRoles} implementation to extend access to the `ADMIN_ROLE`.

revokeRoles(address,uint256).notice: Override the {OwnableRoles} implementation to extend access to the `ADMIN_ROLE`.

unacknowledgeEdge(bytes32,bytes,bytes).notice: Unacknowledge an edge using an ECDSA signature.

documentation.text: @notice The set of edge IDs in the graph. Enumerable to enable on-chain graph traversal in the future.
@notice Edges are relationships between two nodes in the graph.
@notice An internal mapping to prevent signature reuse.
@notice Modified to check the signature for a proxied acknowledgment.
